text: Qiu Guohong (; born December 1957) is a Chinese diplomat and currently the Chinese Ambassador to South Korea. ==Life and career== Qiu was born and raised in Shanghai. After graduating from Shanghai International Studies University he was assigned to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China. He spent 20 years working in the Chinese Embassy in Japan before serving as deputy director of the Asian Affairs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China. In November 2008 he was promoted to become the Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, a position he held until April 2011. He was director of Security Affairs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in April 2011, and held that office until January 2014. In January 2014, he was appointed the Chinese Ambassador to South Korea by 12th Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, succeeding Zhang Xinsen. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:Shanghai International Studies University alumni Category:Living people Category:Ambassadors of China to South Korea Category:Ambassadors of China to Nepal
title: Qiu Guohong
